tool.name: Circos: Link Density Track
tool.description: reduce links to a density plot
tool.command:
binlinks -bin_size $bin_size #if str($link_end) != '': -link_end '$link_end' #end if
#if str($output_style) != '': -output_style $output_style #end if
$num $log $normalize
< '$linksfile' | sed 's/ /\t/g' > '$outfile'

param.name: linksfile
param.label: Links file
param.help: This should be a 6 column (or 7 with additional k=v pairs) tabular file of link data.

param.name: link_end
param.label: Link End Behaviour
param.help: Controls which end(s) of the link are processed for each bin. The start of the link is considered to be the end defined by the first link line, and the link end is defined by the second link line. For example, if -link_end=start then a bin will contain the sum (or number if -num is used) of links that start at that bin. If -link_end==end then links that end at that bin will be used. Finally, -link_end=both will make the bin value reflect the total outgoing and incoming links. (from the Circos Manual)

param.name: output_style
param.label: Output Style
param.help: Controls which end(s) of the link are processed for each bin. The start of the link is considered to be the end defined by the first link line, and the link end is defined by the second link line. For example, if -link_end=start then a bin will contain the sum (or number if -num is used) of links that start at that bin. If -link_end==end then links that end at that bin will be used. Finally, -link_end=both will make the bin value reflect the total outgoing and incoming links. (from the Circos Manual)
param.option: Link density for each target chromosome
Link density for each target chromosome (stacked histogram)

param.name: num
param.label: Use number of links rather than sum of ends
param.help: If the end of a link spans bins, each bin will contain a +1 contribution from the link. In other words, the sum of bin values may be larger than the number of links. (from the Circos Manual)

param.name: normalize
param.label: Normalize
param.help: This only works when you select 'stacked histograms' in the 'Output Style' section.

tool.help:
From the `official documentation <http://circos.ca/documentation/tutorials/utilities/density_tracks/>`__
The purpose of this script is to generate data for histogram and highlight tracks that stores the number, size and consensus position of links. All chromosomes in the input link file are divided into bins (controlled by -bin_size), and link statistics are calculated on a bin-by-bin basis.
